required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Goal Achievement After Utilizing an Anti-PCSK9 Antibody in Statin Intolerant Subjects-4
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Evolocumab, Compared With Ezetimibe, in Hypercholesterolemic Japanese Subjects Unable to Tolerate an Effective Dose of a HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor Due to Muscle Related Side Effects

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study was to evaluate the effect of 12 weeks of subcutaneous (SC) evolocumab compared with ezetimibe, on percent change from baseline in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) in hypercholesterolemic adults unable to tolerate an effective dose of a statin.

detailed_description.textblock: After screening participants who met all inclusion/exclusion criteria were randomized with an allocation ratio of 2:2:1:1 into 4 groups: evolocumab (AMG 145) 420 mg administered by subcutaneous injection monthly and placebo pill daily; evolocumab 140 mg administered by subcutaneous injection every two weeks and placebo pill by mouth daily; placebo 420 mg administered by subcutaneous injection monthly and ezetimibe 10 mg pill daily; placebo 140 mg administered subcutaneous injection every two weeks and ezetimibe 10 mg pill daily. Randomization was stratified by screening LDL-C level and baseline statin use. Participants on low or atypical statin dose therapy must have been on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks prior to screening and throughout the blinded portion of the study; the dose could not be adjusted during screening and for the duration of the study. After Week 12, ezetimibe was discontinued and participants moved to an open-label dose of evolocumab administered by subcutaneous injection either every two weeks or monthly and their standard of care.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) at the Mean of Weeks 10 and 12
primary_outcome.description: For all efficacy endpoints the two dosing regimens (every 2 weeks and every month) for each treatment were pooled for analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) at Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in LDL-C at the Mean of Weeks 10 and 12
Change From Baseline in LDL-C at Week 12
Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a Mean LDL-C at Weeks 10 and 12 of Less Than 70 mg/dL
secondary_outcome.description: Mean low density lipoprotein-cholesterol response was defined as LDL-C < 70 mg/dL [1.8 mol/L].

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved a LDL-C of Less Than 70 mg/dL at Week 12

arm_group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks. From week 12 participants received open-label evolocumab 140 mg subcutaneously once every 2 weeks until week 48.

Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once a month and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks. From week 12 participants received open-label evolocumab 420 mg subcutaneously once a month until week 48.

Participants received 140 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks. From week 12 participants received open-label evolocumab 140 mg subcutaneously once every 2 weeks until week 48.

Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once a month and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks. From week 12 participants received open-label evolocumab 420 mg subcutaneously once a month until week 48.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female ≥ 20 to ≤ 80 years of age
- Japanese by self-identification
- Not on a statin or on a low dose statin with stable dose for at least 4 weeks.
- Subject not at LDL-C goal
- History of statin intolerance to at least 2 statins
- Lipid lowering therapy has been stable prior to screening for at least 4 weeks
- Fasting triglycerides ≤ 400 mg/dL
Exclusion Criteria:
- New York Heart Association (NYHA) III or IV heart failure
- Uncontrolled cardiac arrhythmia
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Type 1 diabetes
- Poorly controlled type 2 diabetes
- Uncontrolled hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 30 centers in Japan. Participants were enrolled from 27 February 2016 to 18 May 2017. Results are reported for the 12-week double-blind treatment period; the open-label period was ongoing at the time of this analysis.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were randomized 1:1:2:2 into 1 of 4 treatment groups for the 12-week, double-blind treatment period. Randomization was stratified by screening low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) level (< 180 mg/dL vs. ≥ 180 mg/dL) and baseline statin use (yes vs. no).

group.title: Ezetimibe (Q2W)
group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Ezetimibe (QM)
group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once a month and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Evolocumab Q2W
group.description: Participants received 140 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Evolocumab QM
group.description: Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once a month and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) at the Mean of Weeks 10 and 12
outcome.description: For all efficacy endpoints the two dosing regimens (every 2 weeks and every month) for each treatment were pooled for analysis.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in the double-blind treatment period.

group.title: Ezetimibe
group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks or once a month and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Evolocumab
group.description: Participants received SC evolocumab 140 mg once every 2 weeks or 420 mg once a month and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks.

analysis.p_value_desc: Multiplicity adjusted p-value is significant if less than the familywise error rate of 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Model includes treatment group, stratification factor (screening LDL-C level), scheduled visit and the interaction of treatment with scheduled visit.

group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks or once a month and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Evolocumab
group.description: Participants received SC evolocumab 140 mg once every 2 weeks or 420 mg once a month and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in VLDL-C at Week 12
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in the double-blind treatment period.

analysis.p_value_desc: Multiplicity adjusted p-value is significant if less than the familywise error rate of 0.05.
analysis.method_desc: Model includes treatment group, stratification factor (screening LDL-C level), scheduled visit and the interaction of treatment with scheduled visit.

reported_events.desc: Other Adverse Events summarizes the non-serious occurrences of adverse events that exceed the indicated frequency threshold.

group.title: Ezetimibe (Q2W)
group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Ezetimibe (QM)
group.description: Participants received placebo subcutaneous injection once a month and 10 mg ezetimibe orally once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Evolocumab Q2W
group.description: Participants received 140 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once every 2 weeks and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks.

group.title: Evolocumab QM
group.description: Participants received 420 mg evolocumab by subcutaneous injection once a month and placebo tablets once a day for 12 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Clinical Trial Agreement generally does not restrict an investigator's discussion of trial results after completion. The Agreement permits Amgen a limited period of time to review material discussing trial results (typically up to 45 days and possible extension). Amgen may remove confidential information, but authors have final control and approval of publication content. For multicenter studies, the investigator agrees not to publish any results before the first multi-center publication.
